document_data.name: Baran al-Amin al-Jinn
document_data.mainbody: '''Baran al-Amin al-Jinn''' was a [[janni]] who lived in [[Al-Yabki Mountains]] in [[Zakhara]] in [[1367 DR]].{{AQ-time}}
document_data.Activities: As a priest of [[Kor]], Baran donned the robes of a ''qadi'' and began acting as a judge at a sacred site in the mountains near [[Turab]]<ref group="note">The references states "...at a sacred site between [[Talab]] and [[Sikak]]..." but Talab is located on the opposite side of the [[Golden Gulf]] hundreds of miles away, so I made an educated guess and swapped the town with Turab instead ... which is near Sikak. and [[Sikak]]. He was popular among [[Al-Badia]], many of whom traveled considerable distances to discuss their problems with him.
